description:
Furuya's not interested in the living, he's got zombies on the brain! When Furuya's cat dies, he decides he's going to try and bring it back to life. In the process, he stumbles across a girl who is involved in an accident and turns into a real zombie! What's Furuya going to do now that the thing he loves the most is right in front of his eyes?

(Source: FUNimation)

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Medicine
tags.description: Centered around the activities of people working in the field of medicine.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Fencing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fencing.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

title.native: さんかれあ 吾輩も... ゾンビである...

node.description:
The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

**Spouse:** [Shouichi Taguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/112059) (December 31, 2018-)

**[Website](http://annabel.jp/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/A_nnabel)** | **[Tumblr](https://annabel-annabel.tumblr.com/)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_nnabel318/)**

**Introduction:**
Annabel is a Japanese-Argentine singer-songwriter signed under the company Lantis. In regards to her personal life, most of her information was unknown, until she revealed her real name via a letter to a famous radio station. Her real given name was revealed to be the same as her artist name, which is Annabel.

**Biography:**
She began her music career in 2005. In 2006, Annabel and singer [Nagi Yanagi (やなぎなぎ)](https://anilist.co/staff/109637/Nagi-Yanagi) formed the unit [Binaria](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3SkdXeqJHKFNXuaHvrj1pL?si=CZChqP69S3O6Dw0TBvdI_w), to date, they have released 13 albums. In 2007, she formed another unit with the singer Bermel.Inazawa called anNina. As anNina, the duo performed the ending themes to the second and third seasons of *[Higurashi: When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni/)*, respectively named *[Higurashi: When They Cry Kai](https://anilist.co/anime/1889/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni-Kai/)* and *[Higurashi: When They Cry Rei](https://anilist.co/anime/3652/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni-Rei/)*. In 2009, she started her solo career as a singer-songwriter, under the name Annabel.

Due to her rise in popularity, she started performing theme songs for the animation industry (anime series). Her first solo was "[Anamnesis](https://anidb.net/song/48723)", which was used as the ending theme to the 2012 anime TV series *[Another](https://anilist.co/anime/11111/Another)*, the single for "Anamnesis" was released on February 8, 2012. Annabel released her second single "[Above Your Hand](https://anidb.net/song/51660)" on May 23, 2012, which was used as the ending theme song for the anime TV series *[Sankarea](https://anilist.co/anime/11499/Sankarea)*. Her third single "[Signal Graph](https://anidb.net/song/52397)", was released on July 25, 2012, which was used as the opening theme for the anime TV series *[Love, Elections & Chocolate](https://anilist.co/anime/12175/Koi-to-Senkyo-to-Chocolate)*. She released her first solo album *[Miniascape](https://anidb.net/collection/8616)* on November 28, 2012.

In 2015, she sang the vocals for the theme song of the 3DS game, 7th Dragon III Code:VFD, from the 7th Dragon series.

In 2016, she formed the band siraph with Masayuki Hasuo and Masaaki Yamasaki (whom are former [School Food Punishment](https://anilist.co/staff/102508/School-Food-Punishment) members) and Yoshimasa Terui (from the band haisuinonasa) who were a member of her backup band.

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annabel_(Japanese_singer))

**Spouse:** [Shouichi Taguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/112059) (December 31, 2018-)

**[Website](http://annabel.jp/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/A_nnabel)** | **[Tumblr](https://annabel-annabel.tumblr.com/)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_nnabel318/)**

**Introduction:**

Her third single "[Signal Graph](https://anidb.net/song/52397)", was released on July 25, 2012, which was used as the opening theme for the anime TV series *[Love, Elections & Chocolate](https://anilist.co/anime/12175/Koi-to-Senkyo-to-Chocolate)*. (Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annabel_(Japanese_singer))

[Website](http://nanoripe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanoripe_info) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nano.ripe/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCL-qIf8MciqDx0VJsQDIsHw)

__Formed:__ 1998
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock (Pop Rock)

__Introduction:__
nano.RIPE is a two-piece Japanese pop rock band under record label Lantis (2010–), affiliated with the entertainment office Highway Star. 

__Biography:__
The band was formed in 1998 with the members Kimiko and Jun who were classmates in their prefectural high school in Chiba. They debuted as an indie band in 2008, releasing one single and three albums before they eventually made their major debut in 2010, while also signing to record label Lantis in the same year.

__Members:__
- [Kimiko](https://anilist.co/staff/169452/Kimiko) (季美子, きみコ) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics (1998–)
- [Sasaki Jun](https://anilist.co/staff/169454/Jun-Sasaki) (佐々木淳, ササキジュン) – guitarist, chorus, in-charge of composition (1998–)

__Former Members:__
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist (2010–2016)
- Yuuki Aoyama (青山友樹) – drummer (2013–2016) ([deceased](https://natalie.mu/music/news/298104))
- shinn. – drummer (–2011)

__Support Members:__
- [Hiroki Takahashi](https://twitter.com/takahashi_drum) (高橋宏貴) – drummer
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist
- [Naoya "choku" Suzuki](https://twitter.com/choku_nary) (鈴木"choku"直也) – bassist
- [Takumi Sugama](https://twitter.com/sugamatakumi) (菅間匠) – drummer
[Twitter](http://twitter.com/burikisan)
[Twitter](http://twitter.com/burikisan)
Shinichi Omata is a Japanese director, storyboard artist, and former producer best known for directing Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinju (2016) and Kaguya-sama: Love is War (2019).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuka_1106)

**Yuuka Sakurai** is a Japanese producer, animation planner and music producer working at Lantis. She is also director of music production at Bandai Namco Arts Inc. since April 1, 2018.

__Real Name:__ 服部充 (same reading) [Tumblr](https://studio-hami.tumblr.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hattorim26) Hattori Mitsuru graduated from the Yoyogi Animation Academy. They debuted in 2000 with their manga [Inu Neko Jump!](https://anilist.co/manga/30978/).

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takuopa)__

**Takuya Matsushita** is a Japanese animation planner and producer.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/258364/)._

Affiliated with [Studio DEEN](https://anilist.co/studio/37/Studio-DEEN).

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/wasabi322) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hinatamasaki/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/masaki.hinata.1)

Formerly affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/66441054)
Rie Matsubara does editing.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.

Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).
